meanings.definition: Cabalas: secret or mystical interpretations of the Old Testament
meanings.sent1: The teacher shared some cabalas with the students during the history lesson.
meanings.sent2: Scholars study cabalas to gain a deeper understanding of ancient texts.
meanings.sent3: The librarian joked that the dusty old book held the cabalas to unlocking hidden knowledge.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with curiosity as she delved into the cabalas of the ancient scriptures.
meanings.sent5: The cabalas whispered ancient secrets to those who sought wisdom.

meanings.definition: Cabalas: a group of people united in a secret plot or conspiracy
meanings.sent1: The cabalas met under the cover of darkness to plan their next move.
meanings.sent2: Rumors spread about a powerful cabalas pulling the strings behind the scenes.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled, pretending to be part of a mysterious cabalas in their game.
meanings.sent4: The cabalas of politicians worked in shadows, shaping the fate of the nation.
meanings.sent5: Whispers of the cabalas echoed through the corridors, sending shivers down spines.
